public class Gather<E extends java.lang.Enum<?>>

This class directly reflects the Gather verb documented at http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/gather All of the descriptions included in these javadoc comments come directly from the twilio website.

Constructor Detail

Gather

public Gather(NestInGather... verbs)

The Gather verb collects digits that a caller enters into his or her telephone keypad. When the caller is done entering data, Twilio submits that data to the provided 'action' in an HTTP GET or POST request, just like a web browser submits data from an HTML form. Note that an 'action' is expressed as one of your enumerated states.

If no input is received before timeout, Gather falls through to the next verb in the TwiML document.

You may optionally nest Say and Play verbs within a Gather verb while waiting for input. This allows you to read menu options to the caller while letting her enter a menu selection at any time. After the first digit is received the audio will stop playing.

Parameters:
verbs - You may pass a comma separated list of Say, Play, and Pause objects.
Method Detail

action

public Gather<E> action(E action)

The next state in the state machine.

Note: below is the original TwiML documentation from Twilio. But in twilio4j, actions are expressed as an enumerated value rather than a raw URL. The parent class TwilioStateMachineServlet maps this enumerated value into a relative URL to cause the next state to be invoked.

The 'action' attribute takes an absolute or relative URL as a value. When the caller has finished entering digits Twilio will make a GET or POST request to this URL including the parameters below. If no 'action' is provided, Twilio will by default make a POST request to the current document's URL.

After making this request, Twilio will continue the current call using the TwiML received in your response. Keep in mind that by default Twilio will re-request the current document's URL, which can lead to unwanted looping behavior if you're not careful. Any TwiML verbs occuring after a Gather are unreachable, unless the caller enters no digits.

If the 'timeout' is reached before the caller enters any digits, or if the caller enters the 'finishOnKey' value before entering any other digits, Twilio will not make a request to the 'action' URL but instead continue processing the current TwiML document with the verb immediately following the Gather.

With its request to the 'action' URL, Twilio will pass the related parameters in GatherParameters, which are available via TwilioParameters when the next state is invoked.

Parameters:
action - Allowed values: any of your enumerated states. Default value: same state.
Returns:
this object so more attributes may be chained.
See Also:
GatherParameters, TwilioParameters

method

public Gather<E> method(Method method)
The 'method' attribute takes the value 'GET' or 'POST'. This tells Twilio whether to request the 'action' URL via HTTP GET or POST. This attribute is modeled after the HTML form 'method' attribute. 'POST' is the default value.

Parameters:
method - Allowed values: Method.GET, and Method.POST. Default value: Method.POST.
Returns:
this object so more attributes may be chained.

timeout

public Gather<E> timeout(int secondsToPressNextDigit)

The 'timeout' attribute sets the limit in seconds that Twilio will wait for the caller to press another digit before moving on and making a request to the 'action' URL. For example, if 'timeout' is '10', Twilio will wait ten seconds for the caller to press another key before submitting the previously entered digits to the 'action' URL. Twilio waits until completing the execution of all nested verbs before beginning the timeout period.

Parameters:
secondsToPressNextDigit - Allowed values: positive integer. Default value: 5 seconds.
Returns:
this object so more attributes may be chained.

finishOnKey

public Gather<E> finishOnKey(char key)

The 'finishOnKey' attribute lets you choose one value that submits the received data when entered. For example, if you set 'finishOnKey' to '#' and the user enters '1234#', Twilio will immediately stop waiting for more input when the '#' is received and will submit "Digits=1234" to the 'action' URL. Note that the 'finishOnKey' value is not sent. The allowed values are the digits 0-9, '#' , '*' and the empty string (set 'finishOnKey' to ''). If the empty string is used, Gather captures all input and no key will end the Gather when pressed. In this case Twilio will submit the entered digits to the 'action' URL only after the timeout has been reached. The default 'finishOnKey' value is '#'. The value can only be a single character.

Parameters:
key - Allowed values: any digit, #, or *. Default value: #.
Returns:
this object so more attributes may be chained.

numDigits

public Gather<E> numDigits(int numDigits)

The 'numDigits' attribute lets you set the number of digits you are expecting, and submits the data to the 'action' URL once the caller enters that number of digits. For example, one might set 'numDigits' to '5' and ask the caller to enter a 5 digit zip code. When the caller enters the fifth digit of '94117', Twilio will immediately submit the data to the 'action' URL.

Parameters:
numDigits - Allowed values: integer >= 1. Default value: unlimited.
Returns:
this object so more attributes may be chained.
